title: Jodie Turner-Smith discussed her upcoming lead role in Queen & Slim for Essence cover
text:
Jodie Turner-Smith is poised to make her debut as a leading lady in Universal Picture's upcoming Queen and Slim.

Stunning on the cover of Essence's November issue, she opened up about the role and the impact it can make, for it's diversity on screen.

Written by Lena Waithe, the film follows a young couple on the run after a police stop leaves the officer dead.

Cover star: Jodie Turner-Smith stunned on the cover of Essence 's November issue, she opened up about her role in Queen and Slim and the impact is can make for it's diversity on screen

She stars alongside Daniel Kaluuya , who plays Slim, in the upcoming Melina Masoukas film.

Turner-Smith reflected on the impact she sees in the role.

'The fact that I was cast in a show to play a female lead and I’m the dark-skinned Black woman with short hair, it’s so incredible,' she said. 'It just gave me a little bit of wind beneath my wings to really go and make this my own.'

The 33-year-old star, rose to prominence starring in Zayn Malik's Pillowtalk video and spots on True Blood and Nightflyers.

New image for a leading lady: 'The fact that I was cast in a show to play a female lead and I’m the dark-skinned Black woman with short hair, it’s so incredible,' she said. 'It just gave me a little bit of wind beneath my wings to really go and make this my own'

Showing an 'intentional display of black love,' she appreciated the projects possible impacts.

'It’s definitely not lost on me how beautiful that is to see [a black love story], for the world and also for our community,' the actress said.

On representation she offered, 'Often, it’s the other way around, and what we see glorified as the standard of beauty is a woman who looks a little bit different than I do.'

Adding: 'And so to get to be in that position, to get to play Queen, to know that there will be little Black girls who look like me, who will see the film and be like, Oh my God, look, somebody who looks like me—that makes me feel really awesome.'

Rolemodel: Adding: 'And so to get to be in that position, to get to play Queen, to know that there will be little Black girls who look like me, who will see the film and be like, Oh my God, look, somebody who looks like me—that makes me feel really awesome'

With a strong and powerful team of Waithe and Masoukas, she was extra motivated to be involved.

Waithe is the only black woman to win an Emmy for comedy writing, and Masoukas has won two Grammy's for her music videos, and led Beyonce's acclaimed Formation.

'All these powerful women are doing this project, and I was like, "How do I get invited?"…I fell maddeningly in love with the script.'

On her director Turner-Smith said 'And Melina is a force to be reckoned with. Honestly, I don’t think anybody’s f**king with her.'

Co-stars: She stars alongside Daniel Kaluuya. Queen and Slim's synopsis described it as 'Terrified and in fear for their lives' Slim, a retail worker and Queen a criminal defense lawyer 'are forced to go on the run,' leaving a cop dead, and becoming national symbols for trauma

Writer: Lena Waithe penned the script with inspiration from Set It Off. She drew on the film 'In terms of Black people being at a very difficult place with their back being against the wall and nothing that they [can] do [but] to keep going,' she told the mag in June

Queen and Slim's synopsis described it as 'Terrified and in fear for their lives' Slim, a retail worker and Queen a criminal defense lawyer 'are forced to go on the run,' leaving a cop dead.

It continued: 'But the incident is captured on video and goes viral, and the couple unwittingly become a symbol of trauma, terror, grief, and pain for people across the country. '

The Emmy winning writer said the film was not inspired by Bonnie and Clyde but Queen Latifah's Set it Off.

She drew on the film 'In terms of Black people being at a very difficult place with their back being against the wall and nothing that they [can] do [but] to keep going,' she told Complex magazine in June.
